content.question: Even with large majorities of their own party in Congress, presidents experience difficulty in exercising legislative leadership because

choices.label: the president must compete against state governors for influence
the weak nature of political parties hampers the president’s ability to control Congress
the president’s use of the veto is ineffective with Congress
individual members of Congress attract greater publicity when challenging the president
the president seldom addresses the same issues as members of Congress

content.answer: the weak nature of political parties hampers the president’s ability to control Congress
